STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 1, 2021
Jennifer Trotter
Girlstown Foundation
PO Box 727
Belleville, MI 48111
RE: License #: CB820201144
Guiding Harbor
525 Huron River Drive
Belleville, MI 48111
Dear Ms. Trotter:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on May 7, 2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and ISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
51111 Woodward Avenue, Suite 4B
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-4532/enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12205 Required staff.
(5) An agency shall appoint a social service worker who
possesses at least a bachelor's degree from an accredited
college or university with a major in a human behavioral
science, or in another major where 25% of the course credits
earned toward the degree are in human behavioral sciences.
There was no evidence verifying that two of four foster care
workers possess the required degree to qualify them for
the role of social service worker.
R 400.12209 Orientation and training.
(1) An agency shall ensure and document that each social
service worker and each social service supervisor
receives not less than 16 hours of orientation after initial
appointment and before assumption of assigned duties.
There was no evidence that four of four new social service
workers received at least 16 hours of orientation before
assuming their assigned duties.
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are unrelated
to the staff person.
4

Two of four new employees had fewer than three
references prior to employment.
(Repeat violation)
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of three foster home renewal reports was completed
two days after the license expired. The licensing
recommendation was sent to DCWL after the license
expired.
(Repeat Violation)
R 400.12404 Placement.
(7) An agency shall document, in the child's record, within 7
calendar days after placement, the information specified in R
400.12417(1) and all of the following information:
(a) – (i)
There was no initial placement outline for one of six foster
children.
(Repeat Violation)
5

R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows, unless a
greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical exam
shall have been completed within 12 months before placement
or a new physical examination shall be completed within 30
calendar days after placement.
Two of six children did not have an initial physical exam
within 30 days after placement or 12 months before
placement.
(Repeat Violation)
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111. All of the
following apply:
(i) A statement from a parent or licensed medical authority
which indicates that immunizations are current or
contraindicated is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
Three required vaccination shots were overdue for one of
six foster children.
6

R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental exam and any treatment
required for each child who is 4 years of age and older
(i) A dental exam within 12 months before placement
or a new dental exam shall be completed not more than 90
days after placement.
One of six foster children did not have a dental exam
within 12 months before placement or a new exam within 90
days after placement.
(Repeat Violation)
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(2) An agency shall have documentation from the medical
or dental provider of all medical and dental care received
by a foster child.
Two of six children did not have documentation from the
medical or dental provider of the care received.
R400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents as follows:
(a) Within 30 days from removal from the home.
(b) Within 120 days after the initial removal and at least
once every 90 days thereafter.
(a) Two of four initial service plans were completed
3 & 65 days late.
7

(b)Four of sixteen updated service plans were
completed 4, 11, 20 & 22 days late.
(Repeat Violations)
R400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(1) An agency shall document the rationale for selection
of independent living as the most appropriate placement
for the youth.
The rationale for selection of independent living as the
most appropriate placement was not indicated for three
of three IL youth.
R400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(1) All of the following shall be in the case record before a
youth is placed in independent living:
(b) The basis for concluding a youth exhibits self-care
potential.
(d ) The availability of specific and relevant
resources that provide for suitable social, physical,
educational, vocational, and emotional needs of the
youth.
(e ) An evaluation of a youth’s need for supervision
and a plan for providing the level of supervision determined
necessary.
8

Prior to placement, the agency did not evaluate three of
three IL youth for their self-care potential, individual
needs for supervision or the availability of specific
relevant community resources to meet their individual
social, educational, vocational and emotional needs.
One IL youth moved without first notifying the IL worker
and then refused to allow the worker in the new home to
determine if was safe. Another IL youth has gone
missing, is not complying with the terms of the IL
contract and only checks in with the worker to get his
paycheck.
R400.12509 Independent living record.
(3)The case record shall contain all of the following infor-
mation and documentation, which shall be recorded within
30 days after placement in independent living and updated
at least every 90 days:
(a) All of the personal information pertaining to the youth
(i – xi)
Personal identifying data of three of three IL youth was
not updated at least every 90 days.
(Repeat Violation)
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(1) There shall be a mutually agreed upon contract
between the youth and the agency specifying all of the
following:
(a) The responsibilities of the agency and youth.
(b) A plan for education or work.
(c) An agreement for the youth to meet with the worker at
least one time per month.
(d ) The location where the youth is living.
One of three IL youth placed on 9/2/20 did not have an
original signed contract.
9

R400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the
youth and the social service worker. The contract
shall be reviewed and updated at least once every 90
days and a copy provided to the youth.
One of three IL youth did not sign two required updated
contracts by Dec 2, 2020 and March 2, 2021.
2.) The agency is in compliance with all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDDHS contract non-compliance.
There are additional MDDHS policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDDHS policies except
the following:
SRM 103 Caseworkers require 32 hours of training annually.
In-service
Training
One of two caseworkers employed for over a year had
less than 32 hours of documented training annually.
SRM 200 SAT training requirement timeframes.
SAT Training
Seven of nine employees were noncompliant with
required SAT training timeframes.
FOM 802 Mental Health Screening within 30 days
An ASQ or PSI was not completed within 30 days of
placement for one of six foster children.
10

FOM 801 Medical passports – Quarterly, signed by caregiver.
Eight quarterly medical passports were missing for
three of six children.
(Repeat non-compliance)
FOM 722-08C Caregiver and parent signatures on PATPs
Two of twenty PATPs were not signed by a
parent.
Eleven of twenty PATPs were not signed by
the caregiver(s).
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings held quarterly.
Three of sixteen quarterly FTMs were not held
for three children.
(Repeat non-compliance)
11

ADM 400 Recruitment – MARE within 30 days of case
acceptance
There was no documentation three of three children
were registered on MARE within 30 days.
(Repeat non-compliance)
ADM 300 Child Adoption Assessment within 45 days
Two of three child adoption assessments were
completed 19 and 25 days late.
(Repeat non-compliance)
ADM 330 Quarterly Adoption Progress Reports - timeliness
Four quarterly reports were completed late for
two of three children. The reports were 25, 26,
35 and 48 days late.
(Repeat non-compliance)
FOM MISACWIS case documentation within 5 days
722.05
The following documents were completed but not
uploaded:
 Three initial placement outlines
 One DHS 69-b
 Three foster home visits
 One signed PATP
(Repeat non-compliance)
12

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
It is suggested the adoption supervisor be mindful that unlike foster care
service plans, adoption reports are not considered complete until they are
signed by the supervisor.
IV. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Interviews of foster care, independent living and adoption staff indicated a
lack of understanding of rule and ISEP-related documentation requirements.
One foster care worker and supervisor said they were unaware that mental
health screenings (ASQ or PSI) are to be completed within 30 days of
placement. An Independent Living Worker was unaware that initial and
subsequent contract agreements must be signed by the worker and IL youth.
The adoption worker was unclear about when reports were due.
A preliminary exit conference was held with agency leaders on 5/11/21.
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan for the 2020
Renewal Inspection during this licensing period with the following violations:
R 400.12212 (2) (d) Personnel records
R 400.12212 (2) (h) Personnel records
R 400.12324 (2) (a) Reevaluation
R 400.12324 (8) Reevaluation
R 400.12327 (3) Special evaluation
R 400.12327 (5) (f) Special evaluation
R 400.12404 (7) (1) (a – i) Placement
R 400.12405 (3) (a – j) Change of placement
R 400.12413 (1) (c) (ii) Medical and dental care policy
R 400.12413 (1) (f) (i) Medical and dental care policy
R 400.12417 (1) (a – j) Foster parent information
R 400.12418 (2) (a) & (2) (b) Development of service plans
R 400.12421 (b) Visitation and parenting time
R 400.12422 (3) (e) Foster care record
R 400.12509 (2) Independent living record
R 400.12509 (3) (a) (i – xi) & (o) Independent living record
ISEP 6.49 Quarterly medical passports
FOM 722-6-06B Quarter Family Team Meetings
ADM 400 Recruitment – MARE within 30 days
ADM 330 Quarterly Adoption Progress report timeliness
ADM 300 Adoptive Child Assessment within 45 days
13

FOM 722.05 MISACWIS case documentation
V. ANALYST FINDINGS
One safety alert was identified by the DCWL field analyst involving no smoke detector
in the kitchen/living area and no operable smoke detector in the basement. Two new
smoke detectors were placed in the foster home.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
June 1, 2021
________________________________________
Deborah Will Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 1, 2021
